parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To pass through, spread (as a report). From dia and erchomai; to traverse.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From kata and erchomai; to come down.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To dwell in, settle in, be established in (permanently), inhabit. From kata and oikeo; to house permanently, i.e. Reside.
Of Hebrew origin; Lydda, a place in Palestine.
